An important goal of transcriptomics research is to understand how different layers of gene regulation are integrated to contribute to functional transcript and protein diversity
51, 52 . The mammalian nervous system is an important example illustrating this concept
10, 11 . Previously, Cembrowski et al.
28 used RNA-seq data to demonstrate a continuous gradient of GE changes across the dorsal-ventral axis of CA1 field of the hippocampus. Other studies have suggested that both continuous and discrete GE changes are involved in the specification of neuronal subtypes from different hippocampal regions
53, 54 . In the present study, we analyzed RNA-seq data from mouse hippocampal neurons from Cembrowski et al.
28 to generate profiles of GE, AS, and APA. The integration of these layers using MOFA
35 revealed important sources of additional regulatory variation between different hippocampal neuronal subtypes.
